channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- Red Hat Satellite 6
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- Red Hat Satellite 6

item.title: CVE-2023-0462|2024-08-02T05:10:56.254Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite%206
item.description: An arbitrary code execution flaw was found in Foreman. This issue may allow an admin user to execute arbitrary code on the underlying operating system by setting global parameters with a YAML payload.

item.title: CVE-2023-1832|2024-08-02T06:05:26.066Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite%206
item.description: An improper access control flaw was found in Candlepin. An attacker can create data scoped under another customer/tenant, which can result in loss of confidentiality and availability for the affected customer/tenant.

item.title: CVE-2024-4871|2024-07-23T16:32:46.503Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in Satellite. When running a remote execution job on a host, the host's SSH key is not being checked. When the key changes, the Satellite still connects it because it uses "-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no". This flaw can lead to a man-in-the-middle attack (MITM), denial of service, leaking of secrets the remote execution job contains, or other issues that may arise from the attacker's ability to forge an SSH key. This issue does not directly allow unauthorized remote execution on the Satellite, although it can leak secrets that may lead to it.

item.title: CVE-2024-4812|2024-06-19T01:24:44.139Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite%206
item.description: A flaw was found in the Katello plugin for Foreman, where it is possible to store malicious JavaScript code in the "Description" field of a user. This code can be executed when opening certain pages, for example, Host Collections.

item.title: CVE-2024-4871|2024-05-14T14:27:41.323Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in Satellite. When running a remote execution job on a host, the host's SSH key is not being checked. When the key changes, the Satellite still connects it because it uses "-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no". This flaw can lead to a man-in-the-middle attack (MITM), denial of service, leaking of secrets the remote execution job contains, or other issues that may arise from the attacker's ability to forge an SSH key. item.title: CVE-2024-4812|2024-06-05T15:06:13.886Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite%206

item.title: CVE-2024-3716|2024-06-05T17:22:47.779Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite%206
item.description: A flaw was found in foreman-installer when puppet-candlepin is invoked cpdb with the --password parameter. This issue leaks the password in the process list and allows an attacker to take advantage and obtain the password.

item.title: CVE-2024-3716|2024-06-19T01:24:14.134Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite%206

item.title: CVE-2024-4871|2024-08-01T20:55:10.305Z -- red%20hat -- red%20hat%20satellite%206
item.description: A vulnerability was found in Satellite. When running a remote execution job on a host, the host's SSH key is not being checked. When the key changes, the Satellite still connects it because it uses "-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no". This flaw can lead to a man-in-the-middle attack (MITM), denial of service, leaking of secrets the remote execution job contains, or other issues that may arise from the attacker's ability to forge an SSH key. This issue does not directly allow unauthorized remote execution on the Satellite, although it can leak secrets that may lead to it.
